summary: This bill, the Agriculture, Rural Development, Food and Drug Administration, and Related Agencies Appropriations Act of 2026, allocates funds for various programs under the jurisdiction of the House Committees on Agriculture, Rural Development, Food and Drug Administration, and Related Agencies. It covers agricultural programs (research, marketing), rural development initiatives, and programs for food and nutrition (including WIC and SNAP). It also provides funding for the Food and Drug Administration (FDA), Commodity Futures Trading Commission, and the Farm Credit Administration, and includes general provisions regarding oversight, user fees, and related matters. The text also includes various rescissions and limitations. The bill also addresses several concerns including the impact of early peanut introduction and potential guidelines regarding sodium intake.
